news_header: Mark Carney, former Bank of England governor, is running for Liberal leadership in Canada, having modernized the Bank and dealt with major economic challenges.
news_text: Mark Carney, the first non-British governor of the Bank of England, is now a candidate for the Liberal leadership in Canada. His tenure at the Bank saw significant changes, including the introduction of 'forward guidance' on interest rates and a more media-friendly approach. He managed the Bank during the Great Financial Crisis and the Brexit referendum, emphasizing economic stability. Carney is also recognized for his environmental advocacy and experience in global finance, having chaired the Financial Stability Board and worked closely with international leaders, including Donald Trump.
